arrays_manipulation_introduction: Arrays are structures that let you store multiple values in a single variable. JavaScript offers several methods for working with arrays:
am_add_and_remove_explanation_one: Adds elements to the end of an array.
am_add_and_remove_explanation_two: Removes the last element from an array.
am_add_and_remove_explanation_three: Removes the first element from an array.
am_add_and_remove_explanation_four: Adds elements to the beginning of an array.
iter_over_arrays_explanation: Executes a function for each array element.
transform_arrays_explanation: Creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the array.
search_in_arrays_explanation: Search for elements in an array that meet a condition.
sort_arrays_explanation: Sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the array.
arrays_manipulation_conclusion: This overview should help you understand the basics of string and array manipulation in JavaScript, enhancing your ability to handle data and improve the interactivity of your web applications.
